//: this is for any scannable paper-shaped readable item, single-sheet or multi-sheet, that isn't a book
note-shaped paper, roughly 1/6 of a printer paper sheet

description: Several documents containing all kinds of information, customer data, and charts, kept together in a manila folder.  Pretty useless now.
//: manilla folder (weighs 15g) + 5 sheets of printer paper

description: A white piece of paper, with the logo of XEDRA printed on its upper left corner.  It seems to be an internal report of some kind.
A brief with the word LIXA on the official letterhead, for distribution to the onsite staff.
A sheaf of papers containing a truly dizzying assortment of graphs, diagrams, and equations, on LIXA letterhead.
A signed and serialed notice distributed to LIXA's onsite military police.
A scrap of paper.
A creased holiday card.  It appears to be a Valentine's Day card from before the Cataclysm.
A scrap of paper.  Something's written on it, scrawled in bad handwriting.
A piece of paper.  Something's written on it, scrawled in simple, messy handwriting.
A scrap of paper with a faded drawing on it.
This grimy note seems out of place, as if someone lost it.
A bright yellow post-it note.
A cyan post-it note.
A sheet of paper adorned with an atom-and-flask symbol, detailing some questionable biological research.
A sheet of paper bearing an atom-and-cross symbol, pertaining to the mental wellbeing of science staff.
A sheet of paper bearing an atom-and-flask symbol, filled with incoherent ramblings about alien geometries and how to get to them.

A collection of documents attesting to the purity of this batch, the performance of instrumentation during its production, and a list of materials used during its production and analysis.  It includes a Certificate of Analysis, each line listing a test method, result, and reviewer's signature, all in service of… something.  On one distinctive page a series of checkmarks slowly appear and fade around <color_yellow>"500 units of mutagen per 500 units of primer"</color> ratio.
Accompanying document, that describes tests performed on different subjects.
Accompanying document, that describes tests performed on different subjects.
A sheet of paper bearing an atom-and-rifle symbol, detailing some very particular security protocols.

//: Low-level animal studies, long-form testing logs - naming scheme compound/subject species-test no
description: A manila folder containing top-secret test data.  Most of it is unintelligible without knowing the jargon, and the contents have obviously suffered from the chaos in this place, but there are some intact pages you can make sense of.

//: Session logs and similar, naming scheme department code-ID-session number
description: A folder full of what appear to be transcripts of confidential psychotherapy sessions.  Most of it is rather trivial, but certain passages catch your eye…

//: Interrogation and surveillance logs, naming scheme facility/incident-material nr
description: A manila folder bearing an atom-and-rifle insignia.  Most of it is concerned with shipping logs and personnel rotations, but there is a single page that feels out of place.
A Dungeons & Dragons character sheet.
A colorfully-printed score card.
A snippet from a newspaper, celebrating the achievements of the one enshrined.

A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It is possibly one of the last issues printed before New England was overwhelmed.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.

A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It seems to date from several years ago, and you have NO idea how it lasted this long.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.

A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It seems to date from a few years ago--amazing it has lasted this long.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.
A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It was printed more than a year ago.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.
A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It was printed in the months leading up to the Cataclysm.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.
A single sheet of newspaper broadsheet.  It was printed in the weeks leading up to the Cataclysm.  Most of the information is terribly trivial or out of date, but one thing catches your eye briefly.
A scrap of paper.  Something's written on it, scrawled in bad handwriting.

Welcome to your Emergency Survival Shelter.  We hope your stay here will be short and comfortable.  Provided are an emergency blanket, high-visibility jacket, gas mask, and food and water rations for one day, as well as an emergency lighter and flashlight.  There are further supplies in the communal cabinets should the facility be over its intended capacity.  These resources are checked and updated by FEMA on a regular basis, but if you find some items missing, please contact a FEMA supervisor at your earliest convenience.

Please wait in the shelter until an official evacuation transport arrives to take you to your homes or, in the event of a major disaster, to the nearest evacuation gathering point.

In the event that you have been evacuated under violent circumstances, FEMA recommends taking cover in the shelter's basement until help arrives.  Remember: if you leave the shelter, we cannot find you to take you to safety.
An official poster notifying the public of a missing person, and requesting that anyone with information contact the listed phone number.
An official poster notifying the public of a missing child, and requesting that anyone with information contact the listed phone number.
A handmade poster notifying passersby about someone's missing dog, and requesting that anyone with information contact the listed phone number.
A handmade poster notifying passersby about someone's missing cat, and requesting that anyone with information contact the listed phone number.
Posters promoting movies that were in theaters when the Cataclysm hit.
//: 27x40 inch poster, assumed roughly 2x thickness of printer paper

name.str: Last Stand 2: Still Standing movie poster

description.str: This a poster for the highly anticipated sequel "Last Stand 2: Still Standing".  Ashton Murphy reprises his role as Det. Harvey Baxter, a retired private eye who delivers pain to those who flee from justice.

variants.description: A poster promoting the animated movie "The Black Freighter", an adaptation of the novel of the same name.  The print is in the same style as the source material.
A white movie poster displaying a balding man in a stained hoodie waving lackadaisically.  He appears to be the title character.

name.str: Fyreguard: A Tale as Old as Time movie poster

variants.description: A vibrant poster displaying an astonishing landscape full of magical creatures.  Above the illustration is the title of the movie in a medieval font.
A poster for "Hunted III", the third entry of the "Hunted" slasher franchise.  Its tagline reads: "You can't outrun it forever".
A poster for "Cybercop 3D", a sci-fi movie about a policeman tasked to take down a group of dangerous hackers inside a simulated reality.

description: A small picture of something or somebody important to the owner, designed to be safely tucked into a wallet.
A medium-sized framed picture of something that the owner wished to decorate their house with.
